screeningSummary: First-time witness with Ring camera footage of three lights merging and accelerating straight up
arcNotes: First-time witness, was skeptical before, now believes something is happening, has some footage

lines.text: Okay so this is gonna sound insane, but last night at about 2 AM I'm letting my dog out and I see these three lights over the lake behind my house. Not planes - they were too deliberate. Just hovering there, completely silent.
lines.voiceText: Okay so this is gonna sound insane, but last night at about 2 AM I'm letting my dog out and I see these three lights over the lake behind my house. Not planes - they were too deliberate. Just hovering there, completely silent.

lines.text: Three lights over the lake. How long were they there?
lines.voiceText: Three lights over the lake. How long were they there?

lines.text: Three lights... okay, how long were they hovering?

lines.text: THREE LIGHTS over a lake at 2 AM?! This is AMAZING! How long did they stay?!

lines.text: Five minutes, maybe. I just stood there watching. Then they started moving. Not randomly - they were communicating with each other somehow. They formed a triangle, then merged into one light.
lines.voiceText: Five minutes, maybe. I just stood there watching. Then they started moving. Not randomly - they were communicating with each other somehow. They formed a triangle, then merged into one light.

lines.text: Shot straight up. Gone in less than a second. I have a ring camera that caught the lights, but it didn't catch the departure. Too fast for anything I've ever seen.
lines.voiceText: Shot straight up. Gone in less than a second. I have a ring camera that caught the lights, but it didn't catch the departure. Too fast for anything I've ever seen.

lines.text: I thought about that. But flares don't hover for five minutes and then accelerate straight up. I've seen military exercises, Vern. This was something else. I'm not saying aliens, but... I don't know what else to call it.
